thread.title: High school football: Five things to watch
thread.title_full: High school football: Five things to watch - Times Union

author: James Allen
title: High school football: Five things to watch
text:
Photo: Cindy Schultz Image 1 of / 1 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 1 Greenwich's Mike Brandow, right, carries the ball during their football game against Hoosic Valley on Saturday, Sept. 19, 2015, at Hoosic Valley High in Schaghticoke, N.Y. (Cindy Schultz / Times Union)
Buy this photo Photo: Cindy Schultz Greenwich's Mike Brandow, right, carries the ball during their... High school football: Five things to watch 1 / 1 Back to Gallery 1 The Indian Bowl is an annual neighborhood football game between Mechanicville (3-1, 3-0) and Stillwater (3-1, 3-0). Always a hotly contested encounter, the 2015 edition also is for first place in Class C's Central Division.
2 Hoosick Falls plays Holy Trinity and is seeking a fourth straight win Saturday. Alex Mendez , a senior who has switched from receiver to running back, rushed for more than 100 yards and three touchdowns in consecutive victories over Lake George/Hadley-Luzerne and Broadalbin-Perth.
3 Greenwich (4-0, 3-0), ranked No. 6 in the state in Class C, registered its third straight shutout with a 52-0 win over Granville. The Witches enter their North Division game against Corinth (3-1, 2-0) having outscored foes 178-7.
More Information
Contact James Allen at 518-454- 5062 or email jallen @timesunion.com
4 The lone matchup this week featuring two undefeated foes is the Class A Northwest Division showdown with Green Tech at Burnt Hills. Green Tech has never won five games in a season.
5 Shaker (4-0, 2-0) can take a major step toward a fourth straight Class AA Liberty Division title Friday with a win against La Salle (2-2, 2-0).
